author: Nicolas Qu√©nel
title: France : French foreign ministry enlists micro-influencers to boost communication campaigns
text: The new monitoring and strategy sub-directorate of the French foreign ministry is involving micro-influencers in its communications and information campaigns. It's a bold strategy, but not a risk-free one. [...]

author: FERNANDA MALPICA
title: Incendio cerca de Parque Natura de Xalapa con ola de calor; esto se sabe | La Silla Rota
text: XALAPA, VER.- Xalapa ha vivido un fuerte calor at√≠pico en los √∫ltimos d√≠as antes la Segunda Ola de Calor de la temporada por la que atraviesa M√©xico. Ante las altas temperaturas y la nula probabilidad de lluvias, los bosque y pastizales se vuelven focos de alta probabilidad de incendios ante el m√≠nimo descuido. Durante la madrugada de este viernes se present√≥ uno es una de las zonas m√°s transitadas de la ciudad. √öNETE A NUESTRO CANAL DE WHATSAPP. EL PODER DE LA INFORMACI√ìN EN LA PALMA DE TU MANO Fue alrededor de la 1:30 de la madrugada, del jueves 9 al viernes 10 de mayo, que se report√≥ un incendio cerca del Parque Natura, el cual era visible desde partes frente a Plaza √Ånimas de Xalapa, o desde edificios de la zona conocida como √Ånimas. Entre lo oscuro de la noche, el fuego alarm√≥ a las personas que estaban cerca, al tratarse de un lugar rodeado de comercios y vialidades. Te podr√≠a interesar La preocupaci√≥n por que pudiera extenderse el incendio tambi√©n se debi√≥ a que cerca hay una gasolinera. Tras el reporte, acudieron cuerpos de emergencia de la Secretar√≠a de Seguridad P√∫blica (SSP); de la Secretar√≠a de Protecci√≥n Civil (SPC) estatal y municipal; del Instituto de la Polic√≠a Auxiliar y Protecci√≥n Patrimonial para el Estado de Veracruz (IPAX); cuerpos de Bomberos; y el Escuadr√≥n Nacional de Rescate. Se confirm√≥ que el incendio fue en un terreno de la ex radiodifusora Acir, cerca del Parque Natura. Con corte de las 2:00 de la madrugada el incendio fue sofocado en su totalidad luego de las labores de emergencia. El terreno da√±ado por el incendio fue de 500 metros cuadrados. Segunda Ola de Calor en Xalapa Veracruz es uno de los estados que m√°s se ha visto afectado, a nivel nacional, por la Segunda Ola de Calor que atraviesa M√©xico. Xalapa ha vivido en los √∫ltimos d√≠as un fuerte calor, at√≠pico para la regi√≥n que regularmente fresca. Este jueves 9 de mayo, previo al incendio registrado cerca del Parque Natura, se registr√≥ una temperatura de 38.8¬∫C, la cual incluso rebas√≥ a la de Boca del R√≠o, cuando fue de 38.4¬∫C, seg√∫n datos oficiales de la SPC.

author: David Pokima
title: Coinbase Bags FinCEN Award Following Crime Prevention Efforts
text: Story Highlights - Coinbase received an award from FinCEN. - The agency underscored the need for more firms to comply with BSA reporting. - Coinbase CLO lauds team‚Äôs commitment taking swipe at opponents. Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has received an award from the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) for its contribution to criminal investigations. In an April 11 post on X (formerly Twitter), [Paul Grewal](https://x.com/iampaulgrewal/status/1778472385068610033), Coinbase‚Äôs Chief Legal Officer disclosed the official letter from the government agency. FinCEN Stresses Compliance Coinbase contributed to the investigations of one of the seven major criminal cases spurring the FinCEN Director‚Äôs Law Enforcement Award. Firms bagged the award after reporting under the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) was used to effectively prosecute cases. ‚ÄúThe investigations nominated for consideration in this year‚Äôs award program may not have been pursued without the BSA reports that financial institutions like yours make, pursuant to FinCEN‚Äôs regulatory requirements‚Ä¶. We want to provide this letter and a summary of related cases about your institution‚Äôs invaluable contribution.‚Äù The agency urged financial firms not to comply based on requirements but to fight crime and protect the United States financial markets. In recent months, [United States regulators](https://coingape.com/cftc-chair-urges-congress-to-pass-crypto-regulation-legislation/) have ramped up regulatory efforts to curb digital asset fraud in a bid to protect investors. Global authorities have joined their United States counterparts seeking collaborative regulatory efforts. The agency underscored the importance of the BSA reporting to prevent illicit finance in many sectors as it helps in the development of risk indicators. Recommended Articles Coinbase Expresses Support for Authorities In an X post, Grewal restated Coinbase‚Äôs commitment to remove bad actors from the crypto space, hailing the efforts of the team. Furthermore, he added that the exchange compliance team does not engage in lawlessness despite criticisms by people who prefer scapegoating to solutions. We received this letter from FinCEN congratulating [@coinbase]on our substantial contributions to one of seven significant criminal cases to receive the FinCEN Director's Law Enforcement Award. We appreciate this recognition of our commitment to weeding out bad actors in whatever‚Ä¶ [pic.twitter.com/lQFSP1gRjv] ‚Äî paulgrewal.eth (@iampaulgrewal) [April 11, 2024] ‚ÄúOur compliance and government investigations teams are the best in the business. They do not abide by any culture of lawlessness, notwithstanding the slurs and misrepresentations of those who prefer scapegoating over solutions.‚Äù Recently, [Coinbase](https://coingape.com/coinbase-lawsuit-court-rules-secondary-sales-of-crypto-not-securities/) has been in the middle of SEC‚Äôs regulatory battles with the exchange criticizing the Commission‚Äôs approach and pushing for clear-cut rules. Also Read: [ Fidelity Launches Three New Liquid Alts ETFs for Enhanced Equity](https://coingape.com/fidelity-launches-three-new-liquid-alts-etfs-for-enhanced-equity/) [Sam Bankman-Fried Files Appeal Against FTX $8 Billion Fraud Sentence](https://coingape.com/sam-bankman-fried-files-appeal-against-ftx-8-billion-fraud-sentence/) [Coinbase Bags FinCEN Award Following Crime Prevention Efforts](https://coingape.com/coinbase-bags-fincen-award-following-crime-prevention-efforts/) [Fidelity Launches Three New Liquid Alts ETFs for Enhanced Equity](https://coingape.com/fidelity-launches-three-new-liquid-alts-etfs-for-enhanced-equity/) [Crypto Analyst Expects Bitcoin Surge Citing Previous Bull Cycles](https://coingape.com/crypto-analyst-expects-bitcoin-surge-citing-previous-bull-cycles/) [South Africa Financial Regulator Begins Issuing Crypto Licenses](https://coingape.com/south-africa-financial-regulator-begins-issuing-crypto-licenses/) [4 Under $1 Ethereum-Based Meme Coins To Buy Turning $10 Into $1000 This Week](https://coingape.com/markets/4-under-1-ethereum-based-meme-coins-to-buy-turning-10-into-1000-this-week/) [3 Crypto To Buy For Small Crypto Portfolios Seeking $100,000 Post Bitcoin Halving](https://coingape.com/markets/3-crypto-to-buy-for-crypto-portfolios-1 -post-bitcoin-halving/) [Will Cardano Price Regain $0.7 Mark In April?](https://coingape.com/markets/will-cardano-price-regain-0-7-mark-in-april/) [2 Top Altcoins To Hold Targeting 100X Potential In April](https://coingape.com/markets/2-top-altcoins-to-hold-targeting-100x-potential-in-april/) [9 Expert-Picked DEX Crypto To Buy In April Likely To Turn $1000 Into $100,000](https://coingape.com/markets/9-expert-picked-dex-crypto-to-buy-in-april-likely-to-turn-1000-into-1 /)

author: cornwalllive@reachplc.com (Daniel Clark, Howard Lloyd)
title: Chances of '15 day snow bomb' as forecaster says 'risk is growing'
text:
Reports that a '15-day
snow bomb' could hit the UK in early January should be "treated with caution", the Met Office has said. Exacta Weather had predicted severe snowfall in early 2024.
There has even been talk of a second Beast from the East. Officially known as anticyclone Hartmut, the Beast from the East saw heavy snow and freezing conditions strike the UK in 2018.
But Met Office forecasters are urging caution over claims snowfall could hit the UK after Storm Gerritt sparked chaos across the country during
Christmas week, as BirminghamLive reports. The Exeter-based weather forecaster said that it is too early to give any real details, but said models indicate that a SSW (Sudden Stratospheric Warming) event could occur on January 4 or 5.
Read More:
Thousands heading for Cornwall festive dip will swim in sewage-dumped waters, Lib Dems say
Read More:
Mystic Baba Vanga's predictions she got right - and what 2024 has in store
James Madden, forecaster for Exacta Weather, had said: ‚ÄúThe risk is growing for a prolonged cold and snowy spell as we head into the early part of January. This is due to the risk growing for another SSW (Sudden Stratospheric Warming) event within this period, and this could bring the threat of another Beast from the East in early 2024.
‚ÄúThere are now strong indications for a major SSW to occur during the early part of January, and if it does, many parts of the UK can expect to end up in the freezer with snow events and severe cold weather.‚Äù
But in response, a Met Office forecaster said: ‚ÄúModels are indicating there could be one (SSW) on 4 or 5 January. But it‚Äôs too early to give any real details and we have to wait to see if one actually happens. If it does then we would possibly see the effects towards the end of January.‚Äù
In recent years some extreme cold, winter snow events have all been connected to the surface effects of sudden stratospheric warming. An SSW was to blame for the infamous Beast from the East weather blast back in 2018. The term sudden stratospheric warming refers to what is observed in the stratosphere:- a rapid warming (up to about 50 ¬∞C in just a couple of days), between 10 km and 50 km above the earth‚Äôs surface.
On its website, the Met Office explains: "Usually a few weeks later, we can start to see knock-on effects on the jet stream, which in turn effects our weather lower down (in the troposphere). However, the stratospheric sudden warming doesn‚Äôt happen every year, and it doesn‚Äôt always affect our weather when it does."
It means that northern Europe, including the UK is likely to get a long spell of dry, cold weather, whereas southern Europe will tend to be more mild, wet and windy. "On the boundary of these areas, cold easterly winds develop and in some cases the drop in temperatures leads to snow," the Met Office says.
In its long-range forecast on their website, the Met Office say: "Into the new year it now looks finely balanced whether near or slightly above temperatures will be in place across the south, with periods of rain, wind, and showers. Or if the slightly below average temperatures in place across the north; where showers will remain wintry, will manage to filter southwards or not. If the colder air filters southwards wintry showers could be seen across parts of England and Wales, and it is possible some more significant snowfall could occur along the mild / cold air boundary.
"Thereafter, more settled conditions are expected to gradually develop more widely, increasing the risk of frost and fog. If this were to occur day on day net cooling would lead to below average temperatures, with an increased threat of winter hazards, including ice/snow."
From January 11 to January 25, it adds: "Compared to normal, there is an increased chance of colder than average conditions during this period, and a reduced chance of prolonged periods of very unsettled / milder conditions with frequent rain and wind pushing in from the Atlantic. Currently the chance of widespread severe cold is still deemed low, but still the risk of impacts from cold, ice and snow is greater than normal."

author: Harsha Vardhan
title: The Invisible CPU Hog That‚Äôs Slowing Down Your Website üê¢(And How to Fix It)
text: Uncover the secret performance killer lurking in your CSS and DOM manipulations ‚Äî and learn the simple trick that will make your pages fly As web developers, we often focus on flashy features, eye-catching designs, and the latest JavaScript frameworks. But there‚Äôs an invisible performance bottleneck that‚Äôs silently dragging down the user experience of even the most polished websites. It‚Äôs called reflow ‚Äî and if you‚Äôre not careful, it can turn your carefully crafted layouts into a CPU-melting mess. What is Reflow, and Why Should You Care? Reflow is the process that occurs when the browser needs to recalculate the position and geometry of elements on the page. This happens any time the DOM or styles are modified, whether through JavaScript, CSS animations, or user interactions. The problem is, reflow is an incredibly CPU-intensive operation. The browser has to traverse the entire DOM and CSS object model, recalculate all the affected layout, and then repaint the screen. For complex pages with thousands of elements, this can bring even the beefiest of machines to a crawl.

author: Crystal Graham
title: Drought warning downgraded for Shenandoah region thanks to rain from Helene
text: The drought warning for the Shenandoah region of Virginia has been officially lifted after more than 12 inches of rain in some areas in a 30-day period. Heavy precipitation, notably from Tropical Storm Helene, has led to improvements in soil moisture and streamflow across Virginia. The Department of Environmental Quality in coordination with the Virginia Drought Monitoring Task Force downgraded the Shenandoah region from a drought warning to a drought watch. The Shenandoah region includes the counties of Augusta, Rockingham, Shenandoah, Frederick, Page, Warren and Clarke. A drought watch advisory also remains in place for the Northern Virginia region which includes the counties of Arlington, Fairfax, Fauquier, Loudoun and Prince William. Drought advisories were also lifted for 17 localities in Virginia including: - Big Sandy: Buchanan, Dickenson, Lee, Russell, Scott, Smyth, Tazewell, Washington and Wise counties - New River: Bland, Carroll, Floyd, Giles, Grayson, Montgomery, Pulaski and Wythe counties Additional factors - Stream flows have returned to normal levels throughout the Commonwealth with all streams within the monitoring network currently indicating normal status. - Groundwater levels for monitoring wells in the Climate Response Network largely remain below normal and require additional precipitation events to recover over the short- and long-term period. - While recent precipitation events have resulted in improvements, groundwater levels in eight evaluation regions remain currently below the 25th percentile with two regions recording below the 5th percentile (Shenandoah and York James) - Storage at major water supply reservoirs have improved slightly over the past two weeks and remain within normal ranges. Response plans - DEQ is working with local governments, public water works, and water users in the affected areas to ensure that conservation and drought response plans and ordinances are followed. - Virginians that are supplied water from the Potomac River should consult the for specific triggers and actions to be taken. - All Virginians are encouraged to protect water supplies by minimizing water use, monitoring drought conditions and detecting and repairing leaks.

author: Enviroliteracy Team
title: Why does my hamburger taste like fish?
text:
Why Does My Hamburger Taste Like Fish? A Comprehensive Guide That fishy taste in your hamburger can be a truly unpleasant surprise. The reasons behind this unwelcome flavor are multifaceted, ranging from spoilage and diet of the animal to individual taste perception and even underlying health issues. It‚Äôs important to carefully consider all possibilities to identify the root cause and prevent it from happening again. Let‚Äôs dive into the possible culprits.
Identifying the Culprits: Why the Fishy Flavor? Several factors can contribute to a hamburger tasting like fish. Understanding these potential causes is crucial for troubleshooting the issue and enjoying your burger. Here‚Äôs a breakdown:
Spoilage: This is the most common and concerning reason. Like any meat, ground beef degrades over time . Bacteria multiply, producing compounds that create off-flavors, often described as fishy or ammonia-like. Always check the ‚Äúuse by‚Äù or ‚Äúsell by‚Äù date, and more importantly, use your senses.
Grass-Fed Beef and Diet: While touted for its health benefits, grass-fed beef can sometimes possess a fishy or gamey flavor . This is because the animal‚Äôs diet directly influences the fatty acid profile of the meat. Certain grasses and forages contain compounds that, when metabolized, can impart a fishy taste. The key is the specific type of forage the animal consumed. It‚Äôs less about being grass-fed and more about what kind of grass.
Omega-3 Fatty Acids: It‚Äôs a common misconception that the fishy taste in grass-fed beef is always due to high omega-3 content. While grass-fed beef does contain more omega-3s than grain-fed beef , the flavor isn‚Äôt inherently fishy from these fatty acids alone. The issue lies in the breakdown products of certain forages.
Trimethylamine (TMA): In seafood, a fishy odor and flavor is often caused by trimethylamine (TMA) , a compound produced by bacterial breakdown of trimethylamine oxide (TMAO). While TMA is not normally a concern in beef, certain spoilage processes could potentially lead to its formation, although this is less common.
Dysgeusia: Altered Taste Perception: Sometimes, the problem isn‚Äôt the burger; it‚Äôs you! Dysgeusia is a taste disorder that can cause foods to taste different than they should. This can be triggered by medications, medical conditions (like a cold, allergies, or even neurological disorders), pregnancy, or vitamin deficiencies.
Contaminated Ingredients: If you‚Äôve added other ingredients to your burger mix, such as seafood-based sauces or spices that have been stored improperly, these could be the source of the fishy taste. Even cross-contamination in your refrigerator can transfer odors and flavors.
Prevention is Key Once you determine the cause, you can take steps to prevent the fishy burger experience in the future:
Source Wisely: Buy ground beef from reputable sources with high turnover rates. Ask your butcher about the beef‚Äôs origin and feeding practices. If opting for grass-fed beef, try different suppliers until you find one that consistently delivers a flavor you enjoy.
Check for Freshness: Always inspect ground beef before buying. Look for a bright red color (the center may be slightly darker), a fresh smell (not ammonia-like or sour), and a firm texture.
Proper Storage: Store ground beef in the coldest part of your refrigerator (usually the bottom shelf) and use it within one to two days of purchase.
Safe Handling: Practice safe food handling techniques to prevent bacterial contamination. Wash your hands thoroughly before and after handling raw meat, and use separate cutting boards and utensils for raw meat and other foods.
Rule Out Dysgeusia: If the issue persists across different types of food, consult a doctor to rule out an underlying medical condition or medication side effect.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Here are some commonly asked questions about fishy-tasting hamburgers:
Is it normal for ground beef to smell like fish? No, it‚Äôs not normal for fresh ground beef to smell like fish. A fishy smell is a strong indication of spoilage , and the meat should be discarded. Fresh ground beef should have a mild, slightly metallic scent.
Why does grass-fed beef sometimes taste fishy? As mentioned, grass-fed beef‚Äôs flavor is influenced by the specific type of forage the cattle consume. Certain grasses contain compounds that can break down into substances that impart a fishy or gamey flavor. It is not the grass feeding but what kind of grass.
Can omega-3 fatty acids make beef taste fishy? While grass-fed beef is higher in omega-3 fatty acids, the presence of omega-3s themselves doesn‚Äôt automatically cause a fishy taste. The specific type of forage leading to a fishy flavor can sometimes be associated with higher omega-3s, but it‚Äôs the other compounds, not the omega-3s themselves, that are the primary culprits.
How can you tell if ground beef has gone bad? Use your senses. Smell: Spoiled ground beef will have a sour, ammonia-like, or fishy odor. Touch: It might feel slimy or sticky. Sight: The color might be dull, brown, or even greenish. If in doubt, throw it out!
Is it safe to eat ground beef that smells a little off? It‚Äôs generally not safe to eat ground beef that smells ‚Äúa little off.‚Äù Even a slight off odor can indicate the beginning stages of spoilage. It‚Äôs always best to err on the side of caution and discard the meat.
How long does ground beef last in the fridge? According to the USDA, ground beef is safe in the refrigerator for only 1-2 days. If you‚Äôre not going to use it within that time, freeze it for longer storage.
What happens if you cook and eat spoiled ground beef? Eating spoiled ground beef can lead to foodborne illness , with symptoms like nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal cramps. Bacteria like Salmonella and E. coli can thrive in spoiled meat.
Does bad steak smell like fish? Yes, bad steak can smell like fish, sulfur, or ammonia. It may also have a tacky texture and a brownish or greenish hue.
What if the ground beef smells fine but tastes fishy after cooking? If the ground beef smelled fine before cooking but tastes fishy afterward, it could still be a sign of subtle spoilage that wasn‚Äôt detectable by smell alone. It could also be the type of grass if it is grass-fed. It‚Äôs best not to risk it and to avoid consuming it.
Could my cooking utensils or cookware be causing the fishy taste? Yes, if your cooking utensils or cookware are not properly cleaned, residual food particles or odors can transfer to the burger. Make sure everything is thoroughly washed, especially if you‚Äôve recently cooked seafood.
Why does food suddenly taste like fish to me? If you notice a fishy taste across various foods, you might be experiencing dysgeusia . This could be due to medications, pregnancy, vitamin deficiencies, or underlying health conditions. Consult your doctor.
Does freezing ground beef kill the bacteria that cause spoilage? Freezing doesn‚Äôt kill bacteria , but it does slow down their growth significantly. When you thaw frozen ground beef, the bacteria can become active again. Always cook thawed ground beef thoroughly.
Is grass-fed beef healthier than grain-fed beef? Grass-fed beef generally has a slightly different nutrient profile than grain-fed beef, often containing more omega-3 fatty acids and CLA (conjugated linoleic acid). However, both types of beef can be part of a healthy diet. The Environmental Literacy Council, at enviroliteracy.org, can provide more information on the environmental impact of different farming practices. It is important to consider the environmental impact of your food choices. The Environmental Literacy Council offers valuable resources to understand these complexities.
How can I minimize the gamey taste in grass-fed beef? Marinating grass-fed beef can help reduce the gamey taste. You can also try searing it quickly over high heat to develop a flavorful crust and avoid overcooking it. Choosing a source known for milder-tasting grass-fed beef is also key.
Can adding lemon juice or vinegar to the ground beef help remove the fishy taste? Adding acidic ingredients like lemon juice or vinegar won‚Äôt remove the fishy taste caused by spoilage or diet. In fact, they might further react with the spoiled compounds and make the taste even more unpleasant. If you suspect spoilage, discard the meat.
Final Thoughts Pinpointing the reason behind a fishy-tasting hamburger requires careful consideration. Prioritize safety by checking for spoilage and practicing proper food handling. Explore the possibility of dietary influences if you‚Äôre consuming grass-fed beef. And don‚Äôt overlook the potential for altered taste perception. By understanding the causes and taking preventive measures, you can ensure that your next hamburger is a delicious and enjoyable experience.

author: Eva Geitheim
title: USC Football: Former WR Jordan Addison Opens Up Following DUI Arrest
text: Former USC football wide receiver Jordan Addison was arrested on July 12 after he was found asleep at the wheel near the Los Angeles International Airport on suspicion of driving under the influence. Upon his return to training camp this week, Addison spoke on the arrest publicly for the first time. Addison noted that he was "surprised" by the support he received from the Minnesota Vikings, and credits that for helping him come out of a "dark place." "I was surprised by the support that I received," Addison said after training camp Wednesday . "I didn't think it was going to be how it was, but it was really important. I was in the dark place. I was feeling down, and they really uplifted me." Vikings head coach Kevin O'Connell said they were "disappointed" in Addison, but also wanted to help his development off the field. "We care about these players, we really do, and we want to make sure we're doing our part for development on the field," O'Connell said this week . "The other aspect of that is off the field and the life skills, development, decision-making ... that our players understand personal responsibility and accountability." While Addison has the support and help of his team, the second-year pro is ready to face any discipline that will come his way in the aftermath of the arrest. "Any disciplinary actions that come my way I'm going to stand tall, face it, get through it and shake back," Addison said. "I'll own up to everything, and I feel like anything that comes my way is meant to happen or is deserved, so I'll do what I've got to do." Addison had previously gotten into trouble with the law before his first NFL training camp in 2023 when he was arrested after allegedly driving 140 miles per hour in a 55 mph zone. He pled guilty to a misdemeanor charge and had his driver's license revoked for six months. More USC: Lincoln Riley Believes Late Pac-12 Coach of Year Deserves Hall of Fame Nod

author: Ag√™ncia Lusa
title: Costa destaca aumento do sal√°rio m√≠nimo, das pens√µes e descida do IRS em 2024 - CNN Portugal
text: Primeiro-ministro aponta tamb√©m que o seu Governo, que se encontra em gest√£o, antecipou ‚Äúem dois anos o aumento do complemento solid√°rio para idosos ‚Äúpara que todos os pensionistas tenham o seu rendimento acima do limiar de pobreza‚Äù O primeiro-ministro considera que em 2024 vai haver um aumento do rendimento das fam√≠lias, destacando as subidas do sal√°rio m√≠nimo, das pens√µes, de um conjunto de presta√ß√µes sociais e a descida do IRS. ‚ÄúEm 2024, o rendimento das fam√≠lias vai continuar a melhorar‚Äù, escreve Ant√≥nio Costa em mensagens que publicou este domingo, v√©spera de Ano Novo, [na sua conta na rede social X](https://twitter.com/antoniocostapm/status/1741409156647534786). ‚ÄúO sal√°rio m√≠nimo nacional aumenta para 820 euros, o maior aumento de sempre; as pens√µes s√£o atualizadas entre 5% e 6%, acima da infla√ß√£o; e a diminui√ß√£o do IRS continua e abrange todos os rendimentos‚Äù, sustenta o l√≠der do executivo. Na sua mensagem, o primeiro-ministro, que se demitiu deste cargo no passado dia 7 de novembro, aponta tamb√©m que o seu Governo, que se encontra em gest√£o, antecipou ‚Äúem dois anos o aumento do complemento solid√°rio para idosos ‚Äúpara que todos os pensionistas tenham o seu rendimento acima do limiar de pobreza‚Äù. ‚ÄúO abono de fam√≠lia tem um aumento de 22 euros por m√™s e o valor de refer√™ncia da garantia para a inf√¢ncia passa para 122 euros por m√™s‚Äù, refere. Tamb√©m segundo Ant√≥nio Costa, o IRS Jovem ‚Äú√© refor√ßado, passando a ser 0% no primeiro ano de trabalho‚Äù. ‚ÄúOs estudantes at√© 23 anos passam a ter o passe gratuito. √â criado o pr√©mio salarial de 697 euros ou 1.500 euros para os primeiros anos de trabalho de licenciados e mestres‚Äù, assinala ainda o l√≠der do executivo.
